Think 63 to retire: Hidden financial dangers; experts reveal smarter age

Fact check: Does Ind vs Pak third umpire have IPL contract as claimed by ex-players?
description: The dismissal of Fakhar Zaman during the India vs Pakistan Asia Cup match has sparked controversy, with Pakistani players and former cricketers questioning the third umpire's decision. Concerns centre on the legitimacy of Sanju Samson's catch and the limited camera angles used for review. At the heart of the controversy is umpire Ruchira Palliyaguruge of Sri Lanka.

MAGA tale: How Obama 'birthed' Trump; and destroyed Dems
description: Barack Obama, hailed as the “Chosen One,” broke the American political machine by turning charisma into consensus and spectacle into governance. His presidency mainstreamed cultural victories but torched bipartisanship, replacing incremental change with identity politics and leaving conservatives convinced their America had been stolen. Donald Trump was not an aberration but the sequel: he exaggerated Obama’s template, weaponising resentment, chaos, and survival as legitimacy. Together, they forged a feedback loop where politics became existential theatre. Obama made history, Trump turned it into farce — and America, caught between poetry and parody, may never recover its lost consensus.

Their comments come as Nvidia announces a significant $100 billion investment in OpenAI, highlighting the demand for skilled workers in AI and chipmaking.

The appeal follows criticism regarding the city's infrastructure, with the CM suggesting limited vehicular access through Wipro's campus could reduce congestion by 30%.

description: The Indian IT sector breathed a sigh of relief after the White House clarified that the proposed $100,000 H-1B visa fee applies only to new applicants, not existing holders, and is a one-time charge. Extensive engagement by the External Affairs Ministry with the Trump administration led to this clarification.

title: Delhi: Over 150 report sick after consuming kuttu atta in Jahangirpuri
description: In northwest Delhi, approximately 200 individuals have reportedly fallen ill due to suspected food poisoning linked to buckwheat flour consumption during Navratri fasting. Authorities were alerted early Tuesday morning, with affected individuals from areas like Jahangirpuri seeking treatment at BJRM Hospital.

description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has advised caution regarding the recent Saudi-Pakistan defence pact, emphasizing the importance of trusting India's diplomatic efforts. He acknowledged the agreement as a continuation of a long-standing relationship, while also noting some concerning elements, particularly the mutual defence clause. The Ministry of External Affairs has confirmed that it will closely study the agreement’s implications.

description: Sunil Gavaskar praised Tilak Varma's fearless batting after India's dominant Asia Cup victory over Pakistan. Varma's audacious strokes against Shaheen Shah Afridi sealed the win, leaving Gavaskar impressed. India's strong opening partnership and Pakistan's struggles with the ball further contributed to India's commanding performance, positioning them favourably in the Super 4 standings.

title: Local Congress leader’s brother shot dead in Ludhiana after ‘argument over Rs 120 bill’

description: Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government, linking rising unemployment and corruption to alleged electoral malpractices. He accused the BJP of prioritizing image management and corporate interests over youth employment, highlighting a split-screen video contrasting police action against protesting students with the Prime Minister's public relations activities. Gandhi asserted that young Indians will no longer tolerate "job theft" or "vote theft."

title: Watch: Zubeen Garg's wife Garima Saikia breaks down during his last rites
description: Zubeen Garg, the Assamese singer, was cremated in Guwahati. The cremation took place with Vedic hymns and tributes. His wife, Garima Saikia Garg, was present. Dignitaries like Sarbananda Sonowal and Himanta Biswa Sarma participated. The Assam Police gave a gun salute. Family and well-wishers chanted slogans and sang his songs. A sandalwood branch he planted was also offered.

title: Ragging horror in TN: ITI student forced to undress, beaten in hostel room
description: Tamil Nadu police have filed a case against three minors after a disturbing video surfaced showing an ITI student being stripped and assaulted within a government-run hostel in Madurai district. The victim was forced to undress and subjected to physical abuse, including being struck with a slipper.

description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon expressed surprise at the sudden H-1B visa fee hike implemented by the Trump administration, emphasizing the visa's importance for global talent mobility within the bank. Dimon highlighted the US as an immigrant nation, advocating for merit-based immigration and indicating that businesses will engage with the government to address concerns arising from the new fee.

description: The Karnataka High Court has temporarily suspended the state government's order that capped cinema ticket prices at Rs 200. This decision follows petitions from multiplexes, theatre owners, and film producers who argued the cap was arbitrary and detrimental to their business. The court's intervention puts the price regulation on hold, pending further deliberation on its validity and impact.

description: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan was released from Sitapur jail after 23 months, greeted by supporters amid tight security. He had secured bail in all cases, including those reopened by Rampur police. Despite facing 111 criminal cases, Khan's lawyer is challenging additional charges in the Supreme Court, alleging attempts to prolong his imprisonment.

Before these commitments, Ashwin will also represent India at the Hong Kong Sixes, adding star value to the side.

Public transport, including trains and Metro services, was suspended, and streets became submerged, stranding vehicles. Tragically, at least three people died due to electrocution in the rain-affected areas. The IMD has warned of continued heavy rainfall in several South Bengal districts.

He criticizes the BJP's past inaction and accuses them of politicizing the issue ahead of elections. His remarks follow concerns raised by industry leaders and a planned BJP road blockade protest.

description: During a White House press conference, Donald Trump controversially linked acetaminophen use during pregnancy to increased autism risk, a claim conflicting with medical consensus. He advised limiting Tylenol, echoing concerns about vaccines promoted by Robert F Kennedy Jr. Trump's statements, lacking medical evidence, suggested delayed vaccinations and questioned combination shots.

description: A 13-year-old Afghan boy was discovered at Delhi airport after stowing away in the landing gear compartment of a Kam Air flight from Kabul. The boy, who claimed he acted out of curiosity, was found after the flight landed and was questioned by security.

title: H-1B visa hike: White House raises alarm; Says 40,000 US tech jobs lost to foreigners
description: President Trump introduced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications, citing program abuse and American job losses. The White House claims companies are replacing American tech workers with lower-paid foreign labor, impacting national security. Trump aims to protect American workers by increasing costs for companies utilizing the H-1B program and prioritizing American-born workers in employment gains.

title: Kirk shooting fallout: Olbermann attacks Stephen Smith; shocking claim sparks feud
description: Keith Olbermann ignited a feud with Stephen A. Smith, accusing him of right-wing pandering after Smith questioned Jimmy Kimmel's joke about the late Charlie Kirk. Olbermann defended Kimmel's comment, which mocked the "MAGA gang," and criticized Disney's decision to suspend Kimmel. The controversy arose following Kirk's tragic death in a shooting at Utah Valley University.
